title: Plant-Based "Steak" Fajitas
keywords: Budget Friendly,Cooking for 1 or 2,Dinner,Easy Pantry Recipes,Lunch,Main Dish,Quick & Easy,Vegan,Vegetarian

ingredients.name: large portobello mushroom caps (stems removed, cut into 1/3-inch-wide slices)
red or green bell pepper (cut into 1/3-inch-wide slices)
salsa verde or other jarred salsa

instructions: Heat the oil in a large cast-iron or other stick-resistant skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushroom and bell pepper slices, and cook while tossing with tongs occasionally until the mushrooms are wilted and peppers are browned, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, add the refried beans to a small microwave-safe bowl. Heat in the microwave on high until hot, about 30 seconds.

Serve the vegetables (from the skillet), refried beans, tortillas, salsa, and guacamole separately so each person can assemble their own fajitas. Use 1 tablespoon refried beans, 1/4 of the vegetable mixture, 1 tablespoon salsa, and 1 tablespoon guacamole per fajita.
